intro: Stillingia lanceolaria, commonly known as the American stelleria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, woodsy areas and is often found in the eastern United States. Stillingia lanceolaria is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
